message.content:
cs.RO, cs.SY, cs.HC, cs.MA, cs.CV 

This paper deals with the development of estimation and control methods for quickly reacting to collisions between omnidirectional mobile platforms and their environment. The paper focuses on the safe interaction of humans with robots, which is a key area of research in robotics. The paper uses torque sensors located in the robot's drivetrain to enable the full-body detection of external forces. The paper also uses model-based techniques to estimate the location, direction, and magnitude of collision forces. The paper then develops an admittance controller that achieves a low effective mass in reaction to these forces. The paper presents experimental testing with a calibrated collision dummy and a holonomic mobile platform. The paper also presents a proof of concept experiment where various parts of the mobile platform, including the wheels, collide safely with humans. Based on the above, the most likely arXiv CS sub-categories for this paper are cs.RO (Robotics), cs.SY (Systems and Control), cs.HC (Human-Computer Interaction), cs.MA (Multi-Agent Systems), and cs.CV (Computer Vision).
